explanation: to surprise or shock someone very much
unable to produce plants or fruit
sentence: She became very depressed during the barren years when she was unable to paint.
sentence_gap: She became very depressed during the ______ years when she was unable to paint.

sentence: We botched (up) our first attempt at wallpapering the bathroom.
sentence_gap: We _______ (up) our first attempt at wallpapering the bathroom.

explanation: to cause something or someone to change direction
sentence: Traffic will be diverted through the side streets while the main road is resurfaced.
sentence_gap: Traffic will be ________ through the side streets while the main road is resurfaced.

explanation: to meet someone socially, especially someone who belongs to an opposing army or team, or has a different social position
sentence: The soldiers were accused of fraternizing with the enemy.
sentence_gap: The soldiers were accused of ____________ with the enemy.

sentence: There was a path through the meadow to the village.
sentence_gap: There was a path through the ______ to the village.

explanation: to become involved with or take part in something
sentence: She was happy to partake in the festivities.
sentence_gap: She was happy to _______ in the festivities.

explanation: existing very commonly or happening often
sentence: These diseases are more prevalent among young children.
sentence_gap: These diseases are more _________ among young children.

explanation: making people feel excited and proud or ready to take action
sentence: She delivered a rousing speech full of anger and passion.
sentence_gap: She delivered a _______ speech full of anger and passion.

explanation: formal; careful and using a lot of effort
sentence: It was agreed that the few students sedulous enough to read the book deserved top marks for diligence.
sentence_gap: It was agreed that the few students ________ enough to read the book deserved top marks for diligence.

sentence: The stench of treachery hung in the air.
sentence_gap: The ______ of treachery hung in the air.

explanation: to clean something, especially a floor by using a brush to collect the dirt into one place from which it can be removed
sentence: When I arrived he was sweeping the leaves from the driveway.
sentence_gap: When I arrived he was ________ the leaves from the driveway.

explanation: to defend or keep a principle or law, or to say that a decision that has already been made, especially a legal one, is correct
sentence: Judge Davis upheld the county court's decision.
sentence_gap: Judge Davis ______ the county court's decision.

explanation: to increase your desire for or interest in something
sentence: The book will whet your appetite for more of her work.
sentence_gap: The book will ____ your appetite for more of her work.

explanation: informal; feeling weak or ill and unable to think clearly
sentence: This medicine may make you woozy.
